geogcomments: near Steveville, Alberta (now Dinosaur Provincial Park); Sand Creek; NW 1/4, sec 31, T20, R11, LSD 4.  Coordinates estimated from map in Sternberg 1950.
stratcomments: originally assigned to the Oldman Fm.

geogcomments: unspecified locality near Idabel, McCurtain Co., OK.
collection_comments: Collection of single individual made on two occasions, once by the Oklahoma Natural History Museum (OMNH 10168) and the remainder by Cephis Hall and Sid Love (NCSM 14345).

identified_name: n. gen. Shunosaurus n. sp. lii
geogcomments: Dashanpu quarry, 10 km NE of Zigong, Sichuan, China
stratcomments: Based on detrital zircon U-Pb dating from this formation (but not this locality), Wang et al. (2018) suggested an Oxfordian age for the lower beds, rather than Middle Jurassic, with 159 ± 2 Ma as the maximum depositional age. However, from a section near the Dashanpu Dinosaur Quarry, Ren et al. (2022) documented the youngest age for the zircon sample as 166.0 ± 1.59 Ma, and weighed average ages of the youngest subpopulation under the constraints of 1σ and 2σ are 170.9 ± 0.64 Ma and 169.9 ± 0.63 Ma, with a maximum confidence age of 169.9 ± 0.63 Ma selected as the final result.
lithdescript: "micro-grained feldspatholithic sandstone, which is rich in mica fragments, matrix interstitial. Wave-ripple cross bedding, micro-wavy bedding and medium- to large-scale tabular cross bedding are clearly seen."
geology_comments: "a lake-shore shallow-bank deposit under low energy conditions"

identified_name: n. gen. Sinraptor n. sp. dongi
stratcomments: 65 m above contact with underlying Wucaiwan Formation
lithdescript: "sandstones, siltstones, mudstones, and minor lenses of limestone"
geology_comments: "laid down in alluvial, fluvial, or lacustrine environments...wide, shallow, meandering, mixed-load streams of low gradient."

identified_name: n. gen. Rahona n. sp. ostromi
geogcomments: Mahajanga Basin, near village of Berivotra, Madagascar. Coordinates are for Berivotra.
stratcomments: three bonebeds: BB1, BB2, BB3 - which should eventually be separated into distinct collections
geology_comments: "shallow and very broad channel-belt system characterized by an ephemeral and flood-prone discharge regime."
collection_comments: Faunal list from formation includes "fishes, frogs, turtles, snakes, lizards, crocodiles, sauropod and non-avian theropod dinosaurs, and mammals", but these are certainly not all from site MAD 93-18. The site is productive and does contain many other taxa, but these were collected at other times, and are not listed in this paper - other papers need to be consulted.

identified_name: n. gen. Hungarosaurus n. sp. tormai
geogcomments: NE side of an open-pit bauxite mine, Iharkút,Veszprém County, Bakony Mtns., Transdanubian Range, western Hungary. An open-pit bauxite mine in the location of the former village of Iharkút in the Bakony Mountains, Veszprém county, western Hungary (Rabi et al. 2012). Note that not all of the fossils are from the same spot in the mine, but all are from the same stratigraphic level. Includes all the Unit 1 sites, e.g. SZ-6 (S part of the open pit).
stratcomments: two bone-bearing beds within section, approx. 0.5 m apart
lithdescript: "The Csehbánya Formation consists of variegated clay and sandstone beds...The fauna is concentrated near the top of the outcrop in 20 cm thick sandy clay, sandstone bed...Most of the fossils derived from 5 cm thick sandy clay layer below the sandstone. Other teeth and bones occur disordered on the surface of the sandstone bed and are covered with clay less than 1 cm thick."\r\n"The vertebrate-bearing beds form 2–3 m thick cyclical units beginning with green clay covered by breccia containing clay clasts, sandstone and siltstone layers (Tuba et al. 2006). Most of the material, including the turtles comes from the matrix supported breccia consisting of ripped-up variegated clay clasts, dolomite pebbles, carbonized plant remains and sand forming channel-like structures with the isolated bones accumulated in lenses" (Rabi et al. 2012)\r\nSZ-6: "a 10–50-cm-thick basal breccia layer composed of gray-green sand, siltstone, clay clasts, and pebbles. The poorly sorted sandy breccia is interrupted by laminated siltstone horizons; these coarse- and fine-grained layers are repeated several times resulting in a stacked fining-upward series of units."
geology_comments: "deposited in an alluvial plain"; fossils "are buried in mud- and sand-filled channel deposits"\r\n"The palaeoenvironment is interpreted as an alluvial plain and the deposition of the breccia could be the result of the episodic filling of a channel or pond by debris flows, silt and sand" (Osi & Mindszenty, 2009).\r\n"a flash-flood sequence deposition, which started with a high flow regime characterized by sandstone and clay clasts, whereas the siltstone layers are indicative of waning flow velocity and deposition from suspension in standing water, following the minor flow pulse. Along with its taphonomic characteristics, this sedimentology suggests that Unit 1 was deposited by ephemeral high-density flash-flood events probably triggered by episodic heavy rainfalls." (Prondvai et al. 2017)
taxonomy_comments: Fragmentary turtle plates are among the most abundant remains at the site.

identified_name: n. gen. Tugulusaurus n. sp. faciles
lithdescript: "gray sandy mudstones and light green-gray sandstones"
geology_comments: "Tugulu Group deposition took place in and around a large inland lake that formed in the Junggur basin under a subtropical to tropical climate" (Lucas, 2001).\r\n

identified_name: n. gen. Alectrosaurus n. sp. olseni
geogcomments: S and W of ruins of telegraph station, about 1 km S of Erhlien; 200 yds S of camp at Iren Dabasu telegraph station; 2 specimens found 100 feet apart
stratcomments: The Iren Dabasu Formation is Early-Middle Campanian according to Xing et al. (2012)

identified_name: n. gen. Planicoxa n. sp. venenica
geogcomments: N of Arches NP and Moab
stratcomments: 3.75 m below top of member\r\n\r\nLudvigson et al. 2010: U-Pb dates from near the base were approximately 119.4 +/- 2.6Ma
lithdescript: "medium- to corase-grained sandstone, and contains lenses of greenish mudstone...The bones occur in the interface between gray lacustrine limestone and overlying greenish mudstone. Evidence of pedogenesis (e.g., red-green mottling, calcareous nodules, possible rhizoliths) occurs in the upper part of the mudstone."
preservation_comments: some bones weathered and trampled, but others in good condition. Nothing articulated. Weak bimodal orientation of long bones, but no evidence of transport. Death presumed to have occurred over a period of time.

identified_name: n. gen. Eustreptospondylus n. sp. oxoniensis
preservation_comments: specimen entered ocean as complete carcass, but not seriously scavenged
collection_methods: selective quarrying,mechanical,field collection,survey of museum collection

identified_name: n. gen. Heyuannia n. sp. huangi
geogcomments: A quarry at Huangsha village, Heyuan City, Guangdong Province.
SW 1/4, sec 8, T21N, R11W, W 4th meridian; 12 mi. below Steveville, R bank, 75 ft above river
stratcomments: originally assigned to the Oldman Fm.

identified_name: n. gen. Angolatitan n. sp. adamastor
geogcomments: near Tadi in the Kwanza Basin, north of Luanda
stratcomments: Originally regarded as Turonian, but now considered Coniacian (Mateus et al. 2019)
collection_comments: MGUAN-PA: Museu de Geologia da Universidade Agostinho Neto – PaleoAngola Project, Luanda, Angola

identified_name: n. gen. Brohisaurus n. sp. kirthari
geogcomments: Sun Chakko (Sun Chaku) locality, Karkh area, Khuzdar district.  15 km from Karkh village, 85 km E of Khuzdar.

identified_name: n. gen. Haya n. sp. griva
geogcomments: Khugenetjavkhlant (misspelled as Khugenetslavkant, Khugenetslavkant) badlands, 3 sq. km area
stratcomments: described informally as the "Khugenetslavkant sandstone facies", overlying the Khar Khutul (= Khar Hötöl) beds; corrected to Late Cretaceous Shine Us Khudag redbeds = Javkhlant Formation. Middle of formation

occurrence_comments: UNPSJB-PV 920, articulated skeleton lacking skull, cervicals, and anterior dorsals
geogcomments: 6 km N of Estancia "Ochos Hermanos", Sierra de San bernardo, W of Lago Musters, S-central Chubut province; 150 m from type sites of Epachthosaurus and Xenotarsosaurus
stratcomments: upper portion of the Lower Member

geogcomments: on a forest track, La Canaleta (CT-19), El Castellar, Province of Teruel, Penyagolosa Sub-basin.
stratcomments: eastern Iberian Range, base of the Forcall Formation, Maestrazgo Basin
geology_comments: a very shallow, tidal, coastal environment
collection_comments: Collected by Fundación Conjunto Paleontológico de Teruel-Dinópolis
